titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation for enforcing the due execution of the Act of Parliament, entituled, An Act for setling the profits of the post-office on his Royal Highness the Duke of York and his heirs males: and for prevention of the inconveniences arising by the infringement of the said Act.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation for enforcing the due execution of the Act of Parliament, entituled, An Act for setling the profits of the post-office on his Royal Highness the Duke of York and his heirs males: and for prevention of the inconveniences arising by the infringement of the said Act.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker, printers to the Kings most Excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Dated at end: Given at our court at Whitehall, the one and twentieth day of June, 1669.
Arms 75; Steele notation: Majesties Conveyance 2) in- Horses.
Filmed copy at UMI Tracts Supplement reel C18 consists of one contiguous sheet.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
